title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pan American Development Foundation
Interview Descriptions: This was pretty standard. I had a phone screening with HR and then virtual video interview with a few staff. Everyone was pleasant, yet typical for large NGOs, it felt a bit stiff and overly formal. Certain information about the job was confidential and couldn't be shared with  me.
Interview Questions: Why am I interested in the role?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pan American Development Foundation (Washington, DC) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Thorough and very poignant. Very focused on what the situation in the ground was in the countries targeted. A lot of attention to administrative processing, budget oversight and working with local partners. Very competent teams.
Interview Questions: What was your USAID experience? Program management experience? Spanish language comprehension and fluency level?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pan American Development Foundation
Interview Descriptions: HR was communicative and efficient throughout the process. I enjoyed both interviews and thought the written assessment was well-tailored to the position. Overall a very positive experience and I truly enjoyed getting to know people within the organization - all of whom were more than willing to take extra time for me to ask additional questions.
Interview Questions: What do I think is the key driver of the current crisis in Venezuela?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pan American Development Foundation
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward process. I had an initial phone interview with HR, then a panel interview on a video call. They mainly asked about my working style and past work experience related to the role. Then a few weeks later received simple email saying I didn’t get the role.
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized working remotely?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pan American Development Foundation (Georgetown) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was great. We started promptly, our discussions were light yet serious and I felt comfortable answering the questions. I was given enough time to consider my responses before I responded.
Interview Questions: What has been your work experience thus far?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pan American Development Foundation (Washington, DC) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Easy, not too long, friendly, welcoming, challenging
Interview process itself lengthy
Slight lack of communication after
Reorganization provided for lengthy process
Good description of how the day-to-day would look
Easy to ask questions
Easy to answer questions
Kind to talk to, to see their career development and how they arrived in their position
Interview Questions:
How would you contribute?
Language skills?
